page.title: 13SOUTH SHIELDS-BEACH,CLIFFS
page.content: The Beach,Cliffs and Foreshore. To the South of the harbour entrance is a fine sandy beach.At the northerly point of this area are the usual fairground/cfeteria amenities,and to the South the land rises to cliffs. Accommodation is provided near the beach by chalets,with showers,toilet and cooking facilities.There is a solarium here. An outstanding natural feature is the{Trow Rock}.Its ragged outline is topped by a W.War 2 bunker.There is a similar emplacement to the South in { {Frenchman's Bay}.On top of the cliffs is a grassed area of several acres,which houses an athletics stadium{Gypsies Green}.This is used for exhibitions, displays and carnivals.The{Great North Run} finishes here.
